thread.title: Adidas, Kia don't join US brands in demanding Blatter quits
thread.title_full: Adidas, Kia don't join US brands in demanding Blatter quits

author: ROB HARRIS AP Sports Writer
title: Adidas, Kia don't join US brands in demanding Blatter quits
text:
October 3, 2015 Adidas, Kia decline to call for immediate Blatter exit FIFA President Sepp Blatter drives his car into the garage of the FIFA headquarters on his way to work in Zurich, Switzerland, Tuesday, Sept. 29, 2015. Blatter was questioned by Swiss investigators on Friday about why FIFA paid 2 million Swiss francs (about $2 million) to UEFA President Michel Platini in 2011 for work supposedly carried out at least nine years earlier. Michael Probst AP Photo i Order Reprint of this Story ZURICH 
FIFA sponsors Adidas and Kia Motors are not following four of the organization's other corporate backers in demanding Sepp Blatter resigns immediately. 
The president of world soccer's governing body rebuffed demands Friday from Budweiser, Coca-Cola, McDonald's and Visa to step down now â€” instead of holding on to power until February's emergency election. 
Adidas wouldn't discuss Blatter's status Saturday, only telling The Associated Press: "The initiated reform process must continue quickly and transparently." 
Adidas has provided the match ball for every World Cup since 1970. 
Kia has sponsored FIFA with corporate affiliate Hyundai since 1999. The South Korean firm told the AP that it doesn't "have any comment at the present time regarding Sepp Blatter or our current FIFA sponsorship status." 
Kia didn't respond when asked if that meant its FIFA deal, which runs through 2022, is no longer certain. Related content
